name: Concentrated Runoff / Stormwater Inputs
functionStatement: Quantity + quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) does not provide harmful peaks or pollution, and supports diverse habitat conditions.
descriptionMarkdown: "Screening metric used to evaluate Reach inflow based on the definition and bin thresholds provided for this metric. Runoff is minimal or well-managed, causing no significant direct inflows or pollutant pulses."
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel; Channel

Method: Desktop (permit/layer review) with field verification where feasible; Field
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Use available GIS layers/imagery and/or a field screening (as applicable) to quantify or rate the metric according to the provided bin thresholds. Count road or highway drainage outfalls per 100 m and note erosion or sediment plumes. Corroborate with available transportation layers if present."

inputs.label: Concentrated Runoff / Stormwater Inputs
inputs.type: desktop (permit/layer review) with field verification where feasible; field
inputs.helpMarkdown: "State/agency datasets, GIS/imagery, and field observations (as applicable). "

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: 0-1 outfall per 100 m, and no noticeable discharge effects. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: 2-3 outfalls per 100 m, with some unmitigated runoff but partial buffering. / 4-5 outfalls per 100 m, with noticeable sediment or pollutant inputs. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: More than 5 outfalls per 100 m, or major highway drains with concentrated discharge. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: DOT drainage or as-built plans (where available)
